name: Mildred
culturalSignificance: Mildred was a popular name in the early 20th century, often associated with kindness and resilience. The name has historical roots in England and was borne by Saint Mildred, an Anglo-Saxon abbess.
modernContext: While the name Mildred has seen a decline in popularity in recent decades, it is occasionally used in homage to family heritage or as a nod to vintage charm. It has a quaint, classic feel that appeals to some modern parents.
literaryReferences: Mildred appears in various works of literature, often as a representation of traditional values and quiet strength.
personality: People named Mildred are often seen as dependable and nurturing, embodying a gentle strength and wisdom.
symbolism: The name Mildred symbolizes inner calmness and the ability to endure challenges with grace.
funFact: Mildred was among the top 10 most popular names for girls in the United States in the early 1900s.

religiousSignificance.significance: Saint Mildred was an Anglo-Saxon abbess who is venerated as a saint. She was known for her piety and dedication to her religious community.
keyStories: Saint Mildred's establishment of a nunnery on the Isle of Thanet
religiousSignificance.spiritualMeaning: The name is associated with virtue and religious devotion.
religiousSignificance.historicalImpact: Saint Mildred's life inspired many religious communities in medieval England.

achievements: Co-founder of the Red Orchestra resistance group in Nazi Germany
historicFigures.significance: Mildred Harnack was an American literary scholar and resistance fighter against the Nazi regime.

achievements: Central figure in the landmark U.S. Supreme Court case Loving v. Virginia
historicFigures.significance: Mildred Loving was instrumental in ending legal restrictions on interracial marriage in the United States.

famousPeople.name: Mildred Bailey
famousPeople.awards: Inducted into the Big Band and Jazz Hall of Fame

moviesAndShows.title: Mildred Pierce
moviesAndShows.characterDescription: A determined single mother who opens a restaurant business.

moviesAndShows.title: Mildred Pierce
moviesAndShows.characterDescription: A woman striving for success during the Great Depression.

characterQuotes.quote: I was always in a hurry to get things done.
characterQuotes.context: Mildred reflects on her relentless drive and ambition.
characterQuotes.impact: Highlights the character's determination and complexities.

celestialData.moonPhaseDescription: A time of growth and development, symbolizing potential and new beginnings.

celestialData.celestialArchetypeDescription: Known for nurturing and bringing comfort to others.
celestialData.karmicLessons: Learning to balance nurturing others with self-care.
celestialData.soulUrgeDescription: A deep desire for harmony, family, and a stable home.

inspiration.content: Love is not a matter of counting the years, but making the years count.
inspiration.author: Mildred Barthel
inspiration.context: On the enduring nature of love and relationships.

booksWithName.title: Mildred Pierce
booksWithName.author: James M. Cain

categories.reason: The name has been consistently used for over a century.
Mildred is often associated with early 20th-century charm.

v11BlogContent.opening_hook: Mildred is a name steeped in history and grace. Once a top choice for girls in the early 1900s, it carries with it stories of strength and gentleness. Today, Mildred remains a beloved classic, symbolizing resilience and heritage.
v11BlogContent.etymology_meaning: The name Mildred originates from Old English, combining 'mild', meaning gentle, and 'þryð', meaning strength. This reflects a harmonious blend of softness and power.
v11BlogContent.famous_bearers: Throughout history, many notable women have borne the name Mildred, including civil rights activist Mildred Loving and jazz singer Mildred Bailey. Each has left a unique mark on their respective fields.
v11BlogContent.pop_culture_moments: Mildred Pierce, both the novel and its adaptations, have cemented the name in popular culture, highlighting tales of perseverance and ambition.
v11BlogContent.personality_profile: Mildred is often associated with a nurturing spirit and steadfast determination. Those with this name are seen as pillars of support and exemplars of quiet strength.
v11BlogContent.variations_nicknames: Common variations of Mildred include Milred and Mildrid, with nicknames like Millie and Midge offering a modern twist.
v11BlogContent.popularity_data: Once a top ten name in the early 20th century, Mildred has seen a decline but remains cherished for its vintage appeal.
v11BlogContent.pairing_suggestions: Pairing Mildred with equally classic names like Henry or Edward can create a harmonious blend of traditional charm.
v11BlogContent.cultural_context: Mildred's roots in Anglo-Saxon history provide it with a rich cultural backdrop, adding depth to its modern use.
v11BlogContent.final_recommendation: For parents seeking a name with historical gravitas and a touch of old-world charm, Mildred is a timeless choice. Its enduring elegance makes it a perfect candidate for revival.
